info.title: Sepio Prime API
info.description: Sepio Prime API methods and models

parameters.name: Uuid
parameters.description: Sepio Agent’s instance unique identifier.

parameters.name: HostIdentifier
parameters.description: Sepio Agent’s instance assigned textual name. usually derived from the HOST name of the workstation. Please note that this may change over time and is not a unique identifier of the Sepio Agent’s instance.

parameters.name: IpAddress
parameters.description: Sepio Agent IP Address.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: Used for both agent status (arm/free) and connection status (connect/disconnect).

parameters.name: ContainsVulnerablePeripheralOrWLV
parameters.description: Indicate whether the Agent contains one or more peripheral that is vulnerable or white list violation.

parameters.name: LastConfiguration
parameters.description: Last configuration time.

parameters.name: Version
parameters.description: Version of Sepio Agent.

parameters.name: License
parameters.description: Used for both license status (Pending/Expired/Invalid/Activated) and license experation date.

parameters.name: OsVersion
parameters.description: Version of the Operation System that runs at Sepio Agent.

parameters.name: LastUpdated
parameters.description: Last Updated time. Format yyyy-MM-dd hh:ss:mm

parameters.name: ExpirationDate
parameters.description: License expiration date. Format MM/dd/yyyy

parameters.name: Severity
parameters.description:
Agent entry severity, numeric values are:
"0" for disconnected device.
"10" for device with all peripherals approved.
"70" At list one peripheral not approved and agent in Free mode.
"100" At list one peripheral not approved and agent in Armed mode.

parameters.name: SortBy
parameters.description:
For sorting the result set, specify the sort category and order.
Supported SortBy values are property_asc or property_desc for example OsVersion_asc, IpAddress_desc.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: When querying for paged set of results, specify the required page number here.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: When querying for paged set of results, specify the required page size here.

parameters.name: GlobalSearch
parameters.description: For filtering the result set, specify a global search text here.

parameters.name: Device
parameters.description: Caption Description.

parameters.name: HostUuid
parameters.description: Sepio Agent’s instance unique identifier.

parameters.name: HostIdentifier
parameters.description: Sepio Agent’s instance assigned textual name. usually derived from the HOST name of the workstation. Please note that this may change over time and is not a unique identifier of the Sepio Agent’s instance

parameters.name: Vid
parameters.description: USB vendor ID of the peripheral device.

parameters.name: Pid
parameters.description: USB product ID of the peripheral device.

parameters.name: Quantity
parameters.description: Quantity of detected peripheral devices. For example, 200/252 means that this peripheral device exists in 200 agents and the total Agent count is 252.

parameters.name: Vendor
parameters.description: Vendor of the peripheral.

parameters.name: ProductInfo
parameters.description: Product Information.

parameters.name: Manufacturer
parameters.description: Manufacturer’s textual name (when applicable) of the peripheral device.

parameters.name: NotApprovedPeripheral
parameters.description: Number of peripherals devices that are not approved.

parameters.name: DevIcon
parameters.description:
Icon enumeration of the peripheral device. Numerical values are:
 "1" - Keyboard, "2" - Mouse, "3" – Storage, "4" – Hub, "5" – Communication Adapter, 
"6" – Mobile, "7" – Audio, "8" - Video, "9" – Wireless, "10" - Security token, "11" – Smartcard
, "12" - Rubber ducky, "13" – Printer, "14" – HID.

parameters.name: Vulnerability
parameters.description: A string indication of a known device vulnerability (if exists).

parameters.name: Severity
parameters.description:
Agent entry severity, numeric values are:
"0" for disconnected device.
"10" for device with all peripherals approved.
"70" At list one peripheral not approved and agent in Free mode.
"100" At list one peripheral not approved and agent in Armed mode.

parameters.name: SortBy
parameters.description:
For sorting the result set, specify the sort category and order.
Supported SortBy values are property_asc or property_desc for example Vulnerability_asc, Quantity_desc.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: When querying for paged set of results, specify the required page size here.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: When querying for paged set of results, specify the required page number here.

parameters.name: GlobalSearch
parameters.description: For filtering the result set, specify a global search text here.

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description: System events entry date and time. Format yyyy-MM-dd hh:ss:mm.MI.

parameters.name: Severity
parameters.description: System events entry severity. Currently supported severity values are Emergency, Alert, Critical, Error, Warning, Notice, Informational, Debug.

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description: System events entry category. Currently supported categories are USB and Network.

parameters.name: Source
parameters.description: System events entry source.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: System events entry textual description.

parameters.name: Details
parameters.description: System events entry additional textual details.

parameters.name: PeripheralIcon
parameters.description:
Icon enumeration of the peripheral device. Numerical values are:
 "1" - Keyboard, "2" - Mouse, "3" – Storage, "4" – Hub, "5" – Communication Adapter, 
"6" – Mobile, "7" – Audio, "8" - Video, "9" – Wireless, "10" - Security token, "11" – Smartcard
, "12" - Rubber ducky, "13" – Printer, "14" – HID.

parameters.name: SortBy
parameters.description:
For sorting the result set, specify the sort category and order.
Supported SortBy values are property_asc or property_desc, for example PeripheralIcon_asc, Category_desc.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: When querying for paged set of results, specify the required page number here.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: When querying for paged set of results, specify the required page size here.

parameters.name: GlobalSearch
parameters.description: For filtering the result set, specify a global search text here.

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description: Audit trail entry date and time. Format yyyy-MM-dd hh:ss:mm.MI.

parameters.name: Severity
parameters.description: Audit trail entry severity. Currently supported severity values are Emergency, Alert, Critical, Error, Warning, Notice, Informational, Debug.

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description: Audit trail entry category. Currently supported categories are USB, Network, User, System.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Audit trail entry user information.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: Audit trail entry textual description.

parameters.name: Details
parameters.description: Audit trail entry additional textual details.

parameters.name: SortBy
parameters.description:
For sorting the result set, specify the sort category and order.
Supported SortBy values are property_asc or property_desc for example Category_asc, Date_desc.

parameters.name: PageNumber
parameters.description: When querying for paged set of results, specify the required page number here.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: When querying for paged set of results, specify the required page size here.

parameters.name: GlobalSearch
parameters.description: For filtering the result set, specify a global search text here.

parameters.name: portViewQuery
parameters.description:
Dictionary of key value for search, the supported keys are switchIp, switchName, portID,
            assignedName, assignedName, portMacsDataCount, linkPartnerData, fpData, portStatusString, cdpPlatforms, pageSize, pageNumber, sortBy
            For example if you want to get port of switch with
            switchName Floor1 and portID Gi1/0/11 you need to send in the query Ports?switchName=Floor1&portID=Gi1/0/11.

recordsTotal.description: The total number of Sepio Agents

recordsFiltered.description: The number of listed Sepio Agents after applying the query filters

AgentViewData.description: Resource for agent view i.e agents table row.

hostIdentifier.description: Sepio Agent’s instance assigned textual name. usually derived from the HOST name of the workstation. Please note that this may change over time and is not a unique identifier of the Sepio Agent’s instance

operationalStatus.description: Current operational status of Sepio Agent. Supported values are Armed, Free.

connectionStatus.description:
Indication of connectivity between the Sepio Agent and Sepio Prime.
Supported values are Connected, Disconnected.

approvedAndPresent.description: The number of peripheral devices that are approved and are currently connected to the workstation (running Sepio Agent).

approvedAndDisconnected.description: The number of peripheral devices that are approved and are currently disconnected from the workstation (running Sepio Agent).

notApproved.description: Number of peripherals devices that are not approved.

latestEventText.description: Textual details of the last event of the Agent.

latestMinus1EventText.description: Textual details of the event before the last event of the Agent.

latestMinus2EventText.description: Textual details of the 3rd newest event of the Agent.

lastUpdated.description: Date and time indication of the last time Sepio Agent communicated with Sepio Prime.

lastConfiguered.description: Date and time indication of the last configuration update of an Agent.

severity.description:
Agent entry severity, numeric values are:
"0" for disconnected device.
"10" for device with all peripherals approved.
"70" At list one peripheral not approved and agent in Free mode.
"100" At list one peripheral not approved and agent in Armed mode.

inAction.description: Indicate that there is pending command for Agent waiting to execute.

pcModel.description: Hardware (PC platform) information of the workstation running Sepio Agent.

nicsText.description: Chained list of the network interface cards (all) of a workstation running Sepio Prime.

containsVulnerablePeripheralOrWLV.description: Indicate whether the Agent contains one or more peripheral that is vulnerable or white list violation.

osVersion.description: Operating system information of the workstation running Sepio Agent.

connectedSwitchIp.description: When a workstation running Sepio Agent is connected to a switch port that is monitored by Sepio Prime, this field will indicate the IP address of the switch.

connectedSwitchName.description: When a workstation running Sepio Agent is connected to a switch port that is monitored by Sepio Prime, this field will indicate the assigned name of the switch.

connectedPortId.description: When a workstation running Sepio Agent is connected to a switch port that is monitored by Sepio Prime, this field will indicate the port number in the switch.

connectedPortName.description: When a workstation running Sepio Agent is connected to a switch port that is monitored by Sepio Prime, this field will indicate the port ID in the switch.

ethernetsCount.description: Number of agent interfaces as seen at network switch ports.

recordsTotal.description: The total number of aggregated peripherals.

recordsFiltered.description: The number of listed aggregated peripherals after applying the query filters

PeripheralAggregatedViewData.description: Aggregated perippherals data per peripheral identifier (type)

description.description: Textual description of the peripheral device.

manufacturer.description: Manufacturer’s textual name (when applicable) of the peripheral device.

caption.description: OS name information of the peripheral device.

vid.description: USB vendor ID of the peripheral device.

pid.description: USB product ID of the peripheral device.

classCode.description: USB standard Class of the peripheral device.

subclassCode.description: USB standard Protocol of the peripheral device.

devIcon.description:
Icon enumeration of the peripheral device. Numerical values are:
 "1" - Keyboard, "2" - Mouse, "3" – Storage, "4" – Hub, "5" – Communication Adapter, 
"6" – Mobile, "7" – Audio, "8" - Video, "9" – Wireless, "10" - Security token, "11" – Smartcard
, "12" - Rubber ducky, "13" – Printer, "14" – HID.

protocolCode.description: USB standard Protocol of the peripheral device.

guiVid.description: USB vendor ID (formatted to the system GUI) of the peripheral device.

guiPid.description: USB product ID (formatted to the system GUI) of the peripheral device.

quantity.description: Quantity of detected peripheral devices. For example, 200/252 means that this peripheral device exists in 200 agents and the total Agent count is 252.

agentsHostIds.description: List of Agents host IDs, will be max 10 size count, others will be ignored.

severity.description:
A risk level indication. A value between 0 to 100 that is: 
0 if this peripheral device is approved in all of the Agents.
70 if this peripheral device is approved only in some of the Agents.
100 if this peripheral device is not approved in any of the Agents

notApprovedPeripheral.description: Number of peripherals devices that are not approved.

vulnerability.description: A string indication of a known device vulnerability (if exists).

adminStatus.description:
Can be combination of values with '|' seperator: 
"WLV" - White List Violation, "WLM" - White List Match, "BLM" - Black List Match, "DMD" - Device Manager Disabled, "FDD" - Filter Driver Disabled
For example: "DMD|FDD"

PrimeEventViewWrapper.description: Events filtered results with meta data.

recordsTotal.description: The total number of listed peripheral devices after applying the query filters.

recordsFiltered.description: The number of listed system events after applying the query filters.

eventID.description: Unique identifier of the system event entry.

category.description: System events entry category. Currently supported categories are USB, Network, User, System.

creationTime.description: System event entry creation date and time. Format yyyy-MM-dd hh:ss:mm.MI.

severity.description: System events entry severity. Currently supported severity values are Emergency, Alert, Critical, Error, Warning, Notice, Informational, Debug.

eventEntityID.description: Unique identifier of the system event entry.

peripheralIcon.description:
Icon enumeration of the peripheral device. Numerical values are:
 "1" - Keyboard, "2" - Mouse, "3" – Storage, "4" – Hub, "5" – Communication Adapter, 
"6" – Mobile, "7" – Audio, "8" - Video, "9" – Wireless, "10" - Security token, "11" – Smartcard
, "12" - Rubber ducky, "13" – Printer, "14" – HID.

details.description: System events entry additional textual details.

AuditTrailViewWrapper.description: Audit trails filtered results with meta data.

recordsTotal.description: The total number of audit trail entries.

recordsFiltered.description: The number of listed audit trail entries after applying the query filters.

auditTrailID.description: Unique identifier of the audit trail entry.

creationTime.description: Audit trail entry creation date and time. Format yyyy-MM-dd hh:ss:mm.MI.

severity.description: Audit trail entry severity indication. Supported values are Emergency, Alert, Critical, Error, Warning, Notice, Informational, Debug.

details.description: Audit trail entry additional textual details.

category.description: Audit trail entry category. Currently supported categories are USB, Network, User, System.

switchID.description: Temporary value which is the IP address when created, Then replaced with HwAddress + SerialNumber(after successfully reading from switch) (i.e.00af1fdcdf00_FOC2002U16Z).

assignedName.description: Switch assigned name(same as cli prompt string).

isStack.description: Is switch in stack of few switches.

status.description:
Switch status, values are:
0 - OK, 1 - Alarmed, 2 - Acknowledge , 3 - login/enable failure, 6 - Connection Error, 8 - Initialized, 9 - Data validity error, 10 - Unsupported, 11- Unsupported model, 12 - Unsupported version

switchID.description:
Temporary value which is the IP address when created, 
Then replaced with HwAddress + SerialNumber(after successfully reading from switch) 
(i.e. 00af1fdcdf00_FOC2002U16Z)

lastPollingPeriodSec.description: Last polling time took to poll all switch data in seconds.

swPollingStatus.description:
0 - N/A
10 - Temp ID (Init): never polled, ID == IpAddress.
11 - Temp ID (Polled): ID is yet IPAddress, i.e. SwDataStatus is connection error or auth failure
20- Normal (Real ID) 
21- Ghost (Real ID): old one, not exists anymore, means that there is another switch (Real) with same IP address.

switchID.description: Temporary value which is the IP address when created, Then replaced with HwAddress + SerialNumber(after successfully reading from switch) (i.e.00af1fdcdf00_FOC2002U16Z).

portID.description: Cisco CLI interface name (i.e. Fa0/14, Gi1/0/33).

portNumber.description: Port number (running order) in the switch.

stackId.description:
Indicate if this switch instance of part of a switch stack.
-1 for no stack.

assignedName.description: Textual name, as assigned by the administrator and read from the switch.

link.description:
Switch port link status, as read from the switch using 'show interfaces status'.
true is connected and false os disconnected.

lastConnected.description: The last time this switch was polled.

localPhyInfo.description: Textual lookup, vendor and if possible model – lookup from Chipset.

portType.description: 10Mb, Fast Ethernet, Gigabit Ethernet, TenGig Ethernet – enumeration(int).

identifiedString.description: Additional details regarding the detected or suspected network element connected to the switch port.

ttString.description: Port tooltip information (on Sepio Prime user interface).

ackMAC.description: The MAC address that was acknowledged (as part of alarm acknowlegement) on this port.

cmdBy.description: User indication (as part of alarm acknowlegement) on this port.

cmdTime.description: Time indication (as part of alarm acknowlegement) on this port.

cmdComment.description: Free text comment (as part of alarm acknowlegement) on this port.

cmdExpiryTime.description: Indication of the expiry time for timed acknowlegde operations.

noMac.description: Does this port do not have any detected MAC address.

linkPartnerData.description: List of detected MAC addresses on the port.

portMacsDataCount.description: Numnber of detected MAC addresses on the port.

linkPartnerInfo.description: Mostly Sepio classification information of the device(s) connected to this port.

linkPartnerCdp.description: Mostly CDP information of the device(s) connected to this port.

switchID.description: Temporary value which is the IP address when created, Then replaced with HwAddress + SerialNumber(after successfully reading from switch) (i.e.00af1fdcdf00_FOC2002U16Z).

portMacsData.description: Chained list of MAC addresses detected on this switch port.

cdpPlatforms.description: Chained list of CDP platforms detected on this switch port.

agentLocalIpAddress.description: The IP Address of agent that is connected to this port

agentHostIdentifier.description: The Host Identifier of agent that is connected to this port

agentModel.description: The PC model of agent that is connected to this port

recordsTotal.description: The total number of peripheral devices.

recordsFiltered.description: The number of listed peripheral devices after applying the query filters.

hostIdentifier.description: Sepio Agent’s instance assigned textual name. usually derived from the HOST name of the workstation. Please note that this may change over time and is not a unique identifier of the Sepio Agent’s instance

description.description: Textual description of the peripheral device.

manufacturer.description: Manufacturer’s textual name (when applicable) of the peripheral device.

caption.description: OS name information of the peripheral device.

vid.description: USB vendor ID of the peripheral device.

pid.description: USB product ID of the peripheral device.

classCode.description: USB standard Class of the peripheral device.

subclassCode.description: USB standard Protocol of the peripheral device.

uniqueSerial.description: A boolean indicator stating of the device serial number is a hardware derived value (USB string descriptor) or an OS generated value.

guiSerial.description: USB serial number (formatted to the system GUI) of the peripheral device.

devIcon.description: Icon enumeration of the peripheral device. Supported values are X,Y,Z and so

protocolCode.description: USB standard Protocol of the peripheral device.

hierarchy.description: Indicates the hierarchy level of USB device or interface. Supported values are 0 for a composite USB device parent or a non-composite USB device, 1 for an interface that is part of a composite device.

approved.description: Indictates whether peripheral is approved by Administrator

present.description: The number of peripheral devices that are approved and are currently connected to the workstation (running Sepio Agent).

guiVid.description: USB vendor ID (formatted to the system GUI) of the peripheral device.

guiPid.description: USB product ID (formatted to the system GUI) of the peripheral device.

parentDeviceID.description:
OS level parent device identifier.
Indicates the hierarchy level of USB device or interface. 
Supported values are NULL/Empty for a composite USB device parent or a non-composite USB device, 
otherwise the parent ID for an interface that is part of a composite device.

severity.description:
A risk level indication. A value between 0 to 100 that is: 
0 if this peripheral device is approved in all of the Agents.
70 if this peripheral device is approved only in some of the Agents.
100 if this peripheral device is not approved in any of the Agents.

inAction.description: There is pending command for Sepio Agent waiting to execute.

vulnerability.description: A string indication of a known device vulnerability (if exists).

Bearer.name: Authorization
Bearer.description: Please enter into field 'Authorization' the word 'Bearer' following by space and JWT
